documentation.text:
@title kyberFeeHandler
 * @dev kyberFeeHandler works tightly with contracts kyberNetwork and kyberDao.
     Some events are moved to interface, for easier usage
@dev Terminology:
         Epoch - Voting campaign time frame in kyberDao.
             kyberDao voting campaigns are in the scope of epochs.
         BRR - Burn / Reward / Rebate. kyberNetwork fee is used for 3 purposes:
             Burning KNC
             Reward an address that staked knc in kyberStaking contract. AKA - stakers
             Rebate reserves for supporting trades.
@dev Code flow:
     1. Accumulating && claiming Fees. Per trade on kyberNetwork, it calls handleFees() function which
         internally accounts for network & platform fees from the trade. Fee distribution:
             rewards: accumulated per epoch. can be claimed by the kyberDao after epoch is concluded.
             rebates: accumulated per rebate wallet, can be claimed any time.
             Burn: accumulated in the contract. Burned value and interval limited with safe check using
sanity rate.
             Platfrom fee: accumulated per platform wallet, can be claimed any time.
     2. Network Fee distribution: Per epoch kyberFeeHandler contract reads BRR distribution percentage 
         from kyberDao. When the data expires, kyberFeeHandler reads updated values.

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "msg.value not equal to total fees"

arguments.value: msg.value not equal to total fees

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "msg.value not equal to total fees"

attributes.text:
@title kyberFeeHandler
 * @dev kyberFeeHandler works tightly with contracts kyberNetwork and kyberDao.
     Some events are moved to interface, for easier usage
@dev Terminology:
         Epoch - Voting campaign time frame in kyberDao.
             kyberDao voting campaigns are in the scope of epochs.
         BRR - Burn / Reward / Rebate. kyberNetwork fee is used for 3 purposes:
             Burning KNC
             Reward an address that staked knc in kyberStaking contract. AKA - stakers
             Rebate reserves for supporting trades.
@dev Code flow:
     1. Accumulating && claiming Fees. Per trade on kyberNetwork, it calls handleFees() function which
         internally accounts for network & platform fees from the trade. Fee distribution:
             rewards: accumulated per epoch. can be claimed by the kyberDao after epoch is concluded.
             rebates: accumulated per rebate wallet, can be claimed any time.
             Burn: accumulated in the contract. Burned value and interval limited with safe check using
sanity rate.
             Platfrom fee: accumulated per platform wallet, can be claimed any time.
     2. Network Fee distribution: Per epoch kyberFeeHandler contract reads BRR distribution percentage 
         from kyberDao. When the data expires, kyberFeeHandler reads updated values.

Some events are moved to interface, for easier usageTerminology:         Epoch - Voting campaign time frame in kyberDao.             kyberDao voting campaigns are in the scope of epochs.         BRR - Burn / Reward / Rebate. kyberNetwork fee is used for 3 purposes:             Burning KNC             Reward an address that staked knc in kyberStaking contract. AKA - stakers             Rebate reserves for supporting trades.Code flow:     1. Accumulating && claiming Fees. Per trade on kyberNetwork, it calls handleFees() function which         internally accounts for network & platform fees from the trade. Fee distribution:             rewards: accumulated per epoch. can be claimed by the kyberDao after epoch is concluded.             rebates: accumulated per rebate wallet, can be claimed any time.             Burn: accumulated in the contract. Burned value and interval limited with safe check using sanity rate.             Platfrom fee: accumulated per platform wallet, can be claimed any time.     2. Network Fee distribution: Per epoch kyberFeeHandler contract reads BRR distribution percentage          from kyberDao. When the data expires, kyberFeeHandler reads updated values.

burnKnc().details: Burn knc. The burn amount is limited. Forces block delay between burn calls.only none ontract can call this function

claimPlatformFee(address).details: claim accumulated fee per platform wallet. Called by any address

params.platformWallet: the wallet to claim fee for. Total accumulated fee sent to this wallet.

claimReserveRebate(address).details: claim rebate per reserve wallet. called by any address

params.rebateWallet: the wallet to claim rebates for. Total accumulated rebate sent to this wallet.

claimStakerReward(address,uint256).details: not revert if already claimed or reward percentage is 0      allow writing a wrapper to claim for multiple epochs

params.epoch: for which epoch the staker is claiming the reward

getLatestSanityRate().details: return latest knc/eth rate from sanity rate contract

getSanityRateContracts().details: returns list of sanity rate contractsindex 0 is currently used contract address, indexes > 0 are older versions

handleFees(address,address[],uint256[],a.details: handleFees function is called per trade on kyberNetwork. unless the trade is not involving any fees.

params.networkFee: Fee amount (in wei) to be allocated for BRR
params.platformFee: Fee amount (in wei) the platfrom wallet is entitled to.
params.platformWallet: Wallet address that will receive the platfrom fee.
params.rebateBpsPerWallet: percentage of rebate for each wallet, out of total rebate.
params.rebateWallets: a list of rebate wallets that will get rebate for this trade.

makeEpochRewardBurnable(uint256).details: if no one voted for an epoch (like epoch 0), no one gets rewards - should burn it.         Will move the epoch reward amount to burn amount. So can later be burned.         calls kyberDao contract to check if there were any votes for this epoch.

setBurnConfigParams(address,uint256).details: set knc sanity rate contract and amount wei to burn

params._weiToBurn: new amount of wei to burn

setDaoContract(address).details: set kyberDao contract address once and set setter address to zero.

setKyberProxy(address).details: Allow to set kyberNetworkProxy address by daoOperator

setNetworkContract(address).details: set new kyberNetwork address by daoOperator

devdoc.title: kyberFeeHandler

claimStakerReward(address,uint256).notice: WARNING When staker address is a contract,          it should be able to receive claimed reward in ETH whenever anyone calls this function.
